Name: HMS Hardy
Builder: Cammell Laird and Company at Birkenhead
Fate: Beached, 10 April 1940. Later capsized and became a total loss.
Displacement:
1,455 long tons (1,478 t) (standard)
2,053 long tons (2,086 t) (deep load)
Propulsion:
2 shafts, Parsons geared steam turbines
3 Admiralty 3-drum water-tube boilers
Range: 5,530 nmi (10,240 km; 6,360 mi) at 15 knots (28 km/h; 17 mph)
Armament:
5 × 1 - QF 4.7-inch (120 mm) Mk IX guns
2 × 4 - .50 cal machine guns
2 × 4 - 21 inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes
20 × depth charges, 1 rail and 2 throwers
